text: check this out: capacitive gesture <https://www.tindie.com/products/ootsidebox/3dpad-touchless-gesture-controller-arduino-shield/>

attachments.title: 3Dpad - touchless gesture controller Arduino shield
attachments.text: ### Make your own touchless control interface providing 3D coordinates and gestures with a 10cm depth perception, in the form of an Arduino shield. ** ** ![enter image description here](<https://images.indiegogo.com/file_attachments/568663/files/20140509113559-bloggif_536d1e9cea89b.gif?1399660559> "enter image title here") **3Dpad is an innovative and experimental system that you can use for creativity, experiments and education.** *The underlaying technology is patented and can be used freely under Creative Commons licence [CC BY-NC-SA.](<http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/>)* ### It consists of a sandwich made up of: - a PCB called an electrode plane (1) - an Arduino Shield (2) - an Arduino Uno (3) - *not included, you should use your own [Arduino](<http://arduino.cc/en/Main/arduinoBoardUno>) ![enter image description here](<https://d3s5r33r268y59.cloudfront.net/01512/products/thumbs/2014-09-04T17:23:16.384Z-130508-proto-3s.jpg.855x570_q85_pad_rcrop.jpg> "enter image title here") ![enter image description here](<https://images.indiegogo.com/file_attachments/565439/files/20140508024603-3_boards.png?1399542363> "enter image title here") ### **Detection principle:** To detect the proximity of the human hand or finger, we are using the projected capacitive technique. This is the principle of virtually all modern touch screens - except that now we are in the air, relatively far away from the detector surface (10 cm max). It’s very simple: We build capacitors which are as “open” as possible, using electrodes drawn on the electrode plane PCB in order to obtain a maximum “hand effect”. ![enter image description here](<https://images.indiegogo.com/file_attachments/565447/files/20140508025006-electrodes_plane.png?1399542606> "enter image title here") The capacitors formed by the electrodes are part of an oscillator whose frequency is influenced by the distance of a hand. When it enters the electrostatic field, this “intruder” is going to cut the field lines and divert the electrical charges. **Result:** the closer the hand approaches the electrodes, the more the oscillator’s frequency increases. ![enter image description here](<https://images.indiegogo.com/file_attachments/565451/files/20140508025202-oscillateur.png?1399542722> "enter image title here") ### **The embedded software** The sketch running on the Arduino UNO will exploit the analog result in order to: - Calculate 3D coordinates - Recognize basic gestures (swipes, push and rotations) - Send it all to a host device on the USB COM port ### **The evaluation software** Despite the fact that everything is calculated on the Arduino board, it can be usefull for you to have a software for a quick evaluation of 3D-Pad. ![enter image description here](<https://images.indiegogo.com/file_attachments/565528/files/20140508034708-softscreen.png?1399546028> "enter image title here") It's available in the form of a VB6 which (often) accepts to be installed under Windows. There is also a new one, made with [Processing](<http://processing.org>). This is more confortable and runs under Windows, Linux an MAC-OS X. You'll see all the values sent by the Arduino Uno, the gesture events and the 3D coordinates in the form of a cursor. ### **What’s it used for?** 3Dpad's technology can be used in a very wide field of applications, for instance: medical & healthcare (should reduce the nosocomial risk), household appliance control (think at cooking when your hands are covered of fat content), gaming with "air control", and many other. At the moment my favorite app is music, using 3Dpad as an "3D Air control" MIDI controller. [Watch our first experiment Video](<https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=-wdQUOxaZXI>) ### **Questions / Answers :** - **What are the possibilities for hiding the 3D-pad behind different materials?** *The electrode plan PCB can be covered with glass, plastic, ceramic, wood, textile, or any other insulating material* [See it in this video](<https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=2Nm65RwdjEY>) - **Who designed the 3Dpad?** *3Dpad is based on my own invention (I've got granted patents on it). The current version in the form of an Arduino shield has been designed in collaboration with the [Elektor Labs](<http://www.elektor-labs.com/project/3d-pad-control-without-touching-130508.13850.html>). A full description is available in the* [Elektor magazine - May 2014 edition.](<http://www.elektor.com/elektor-magazine-en-may-2014>) - **How will be made the 3Dpad that you ordered?** *Today this product is "hand made" by myself: Assembling, soldering all components, and full testing. If the demand continues to grow, tomorow the manufacturing will be done by sub-contractors.* ### **Find out more about 3Dpad:** - [Elektor 3D pad: Touchless Gesture Control interface, guaranteed "Wow!" value](<http://youtu.be/Eoqj1DyjiHA>) - [Elektor Academy / Element14 (3Dpad) webinar podcast](<http://ootsidebox.blogspot.fr/2014/06/elektor-academy-element14-3dpad-webinar.html>) - [3Dpad on Facebook](<https://www.facebook.com/3D.Pad>) ### **Find out more about me:** ![enter image description here](<https://images.indiegogo.com/file_attachments/561504/files/20140506135740-photo_google.jpg?1399409860> "enter image title here") - [Join my Linkedin network](<http://fr.linkedin.com/in/jnlootsidebox/>) - [visit my workspace](<http://circuitcellar.com/community/workspaces/a-personal-hackerspace-in-lyon-france/>) - [ATMEL's Interview: Jean-Noël talks Ootsidebox](<http://atmelcorporation.wordpress.com/2014/03/05/interview-jean-noel-talks-ootsidebox/>) - [Ootsidebox Touchless Interface at Elektor.Labs](<http://youtu.be/yyR7JzCk8gs>) ### **Find out more about OOTSIDEBOX:** ![enter image description here](<http://www.ootsidebox.com/rw_common/images/logo-ootsidebox-opt.png> "enter image title here") - [Website](<http://www.ootsidebox.com>) - [Facebook](<https://www.facebook.com/ootsidebox>) - [Twitter](<https://twitter.com/Ootsidebox>)
attachments.fallback: Tindie: 3Dpad - touchless gesture controller Arduino shield

text: Digging to find one out there. For expediency, we should stick with something like PrimeSense for now, look at that for a product spect
spec*
hmm are we going to need an additional conventional camera so we CAN use OpenCV? Do depth cameras only provide depth data?
you know, for size and the fact we need pretty basic functionality, that Creative unit would do it
these cams all provide both depth and rgb out
ok
phew
here's my vote(s):
the Intel/Creative unit since 1) The SDK looks usable and 2) I can get some help on the inside if we need it and 3) I did and Android port for the SDK :simple_smile:
PrimeSense since it's better at close-range than Kinect is
BTW...I've been waiting for a couple contacts to get back from vacation/travel at Intel to get more info on cameras. Will follow up today and post results here
badass
just talked to a contact on the Perceptual Computing team
told him I was looking for a small depth+video camera that can do close-range (<6ft)
his recommendation was to go with the Creative cam - high frame rate (>30fps), 720p + depth
means we can resolve click events on a projected UI
plus the PerC toolkit is specifically developed for recognizing hand shapes and gestures. not strictly what we're doing, but useful
also easy to integrate with OpenCV

the UW team did work on projecting UIs on non-flat surfaces with this cam and a standard projector, so that code should be in the public domain (getting back to the original RFP, should that ever come around again)
not sure if this one has been thrown out yet but i stumbled onto an ASUS depth camera <http://www.asus.com/Multimedia/Xtion_PRO/specifications/>

attachments.text: Use the Xtion PRO bundled with the OPNI NITE SDK that is middleware compatible to develop and create your own motion-sensing software that can also be sold on the ASUS @vibe site.
